intro: Racosperma donaldsonii, commonly known as the Darwin's wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow flowers in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
